title: Cory Denniss
text:
Cory Denniss (born 18 June 1997) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a and er for the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>. 
He previously played for the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>.
Background.
Denniss was born in <a href="Belmont%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Belmont, New South Wales</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>.
He played his junior rugby league for <a href="Lakes%20United">Lakes United</a> in the <a href="Newcastle%20Rugby%20League">Newcastle Rugby League</a>, before being signed by the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>.
Playing career.
2016.
In 2016, Denniss played for the Newcastle Knights' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team. In round 3 of the <a href="2016%20NRL%20season">2016 NRL season</a>, after just two games in the NYC, he was called up to make his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the Knights against the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> after regular winger <a href="Akuila%20Uate">Akuila Uate</a> was ruled out with injury. He scored two tries on debut. In July, he played for the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> under-20s team against the <a href="Queensland%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a> under-20s team. He finished his debut season having played in 7 matches and scoring 3 tries. In November, he extended his contract with the Knights until the end of 2018.
2017.
2017 was a quieter year for Denniss, spending the entirety of the season in the Knights' lower grade sides.
2018.
After spending the first 12 rounds in the Knights' <a href="Intrust%20Super%20Premiership%20NSW">Intrust Super Premiership NSW</a> side, Denniss was called up for a return to the NRL side, playing at centre against the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> in the Knights' 30-4 win. He parted ways with the Knights at the end of the season.
In December, Denniss signed a 2-year contract with the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> starting in 2019.
2019 & 2020.
Denniss made no appearances for South Sydney in the <a href="2019%20NRL%20season">2019 NRL season</a> and <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a>'s. On 9 November 2020, he was released by South Sydney.
